[[Sea of Swords]], [[Baldur's Gate]]

document_data.mainbody: '''Halibut''' was a species of saltwater [[fish]] and a common source of food for the coastal communities of [[Faerûn]] and [[Kara-Tur]].
document_data.Description: Halibut was a species of brown-colored on top and white bottom flatfish that could reach relatively massive size. This fish was popular for its fresh taste and solid texture, especially palatable when grilled.
document_data.Ecology:
Halibut could be found inhabiting the [[Sea of Swords]] near the [[Baldur's Gate]], feeding the city's fishers. Halibut was also found in the [[Sea of Fallen Stars]]: the eastern nation of [[Aglarond]] and [[Ravens Bluff]] in [[the Vast]], where halibut was sold at the [[Shark Fin]] eatery for a single [[silver]] [[coin|piece]].

Beyond Faerûn, halibut inhabited cold oceans of Kara-Tur.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, [[Pilos Lafrett]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] invented a device that used balanced weights that would allow the fisher to do the fishing on its own, while Pilos could nap. His boss [[Tohil]] was informed of the invention and that it would be producing labor-free halibut.
